result.title:
Description 

When you opt in for this system property, your service portfolios will upgrade from the Legacy structure to the improved and more flexible Standard portfolio structure. In the upgrade, your existing portfolios will remain intact, but they will lose the performance metrics, scores, and weights. With the improved Standard service portfolios, you can use KPI Groups to report on services, nodes, and portfolio performance. For information, see the related documentation links. 

 

WARNING:  Once you opt into the improved Standard service portfolio, you cannot revert to Legacy service portfolios.  

 

Considerations before you opt into this system property:

   Opt in for Standard service portfolios   Don't opt in - Keep Legacy service portfolios

 

  • Layer records are not required – Users use node-to-node relationships to create service portfolios with different levels of depth in a single portfolio. 
  • Cannot report using portfolio performance metrics, scores, and weights. 
  • Report on services, nodes, and portfolio performance using KPI Groups in Digital Portfolio Management. 

 

  • Layer records are required - users assign nodes to a layer and then reference the parent/child node. 
  • Continue to use portfolio performance metrics, scores, and weights. 
  • Cannot report using KPI Groups in Digital Portfolio Management.  

 

Related documentation: 

Digital Portfolio Management 

KPI Groups in Digital Portfolio Management 

Create KPI groups, mappings, and visualizations
result.name: Before you opt-in

result.title:
Description

According to NIST guidelines, 3DES is officially retired. It is allowed for encryption until December 2023, and decryption for legacy use.

Beginning in the Rome release, password2 data is protected using the Key Management Framework, which uses the more modern Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm. However, some configurations in password2 logic can still use the 3DES algorithm for encryption and decryption.

Administrators may request 3DES deprecation to ensure that your instance uses the more secure Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) exclusively for the encryption and decryption of your Password2 data. Please see below options to remove the usage of 3DES from your instance.

Complete Deprecation

Enabling complete deprecation will remove the usage of 3DES for all the password2 fields in the customer instance. If all the considerations are met, then there will be no configuration or scenarios where 3DES will be used in password2 fields. To enable complete deprecation, please follow below steps.

  1. Do you want to opt-in for 3DES deprecation for password2 fields?
    • Value = Yes
  2. Do you want to continue using 3DES in legacy password2 fields?
    • Value = No

Reference Documentation

  • Enable 3DES deprecation for password2 fields
  • Password2 3DES deprecation
  • Errors while Updating a password2 field value or while adding a new record with password2 data
result.name: Password2 Triple DES Deprecation

result.title: MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) is a crucial security measure that safeguards user accounts from potential threats like stolen credentials, credential stuffing, password spraying and phishing attacks. It plays a key role in reducing the risk of unauthorized access, thereby enhancing the security of your data and systems. We highly advise against turning off MFA. Instead, you can modify the MFA context policy to customize MFA enforcement. For more detailed guidance, please refer to the FAQ section of this MFA Implementation Guide.
result.name: MultifactorAuthDisable
